short_description: Two core sleeps with a short gap between them, maximizing SWS and REM sleep.
classification: Biphasic schedule in a Dual Core style
ideal_scheduling: 1 core around 21:00, should not be later than 22:00ish, 1 core till morning

short_description: One long core sleep at night and a shorter nap around noon.
ideal_scheduling: Core around midnight, siesta at noon

short_description: One long core sleep with flexible nap(s) varying in length depending on need.
ideal_scheduling: Consistent dark period everyday, core sleep starts 1-2 hours after dark period. Nap during daytime, no later than 6 PM

short_description: One long core sleep during nighttime hours and a short nap around noon.
classification: Biphasic schedule in an Everyman style
ideal_scheduling: Core close to midnight, early-afternoon nap

short_description: One long core sleep during nighttime hours and two short naps throughout the day.
ideal_scheduling: Core close to midnight, nap before work, early-afternoon nap

short_description: One core sleep at night and three short naps strategically placed throughout the day.
ideal_scheduling: Core starts around 21:00, naps in early morning, post-dawn, and early afternoon

short_description: A minimal core sleep before midnight and four short naps distributed throughout the day.
ideal_scheduling: Core before midnight, naps in the morning, noon, and afternoon

short_description: A minimal core sleep before midnight and five short naps placed similarly to Uberman.
ideal_scheduling: Core before midnight, naps in Uberman-like fashion

short_description: Flexible variant including a core sleep and multiple short naps, evolving from SPAMAYL.
classification: Flexible schedule, SPAMAYL variant, Everyman variant
ideal_scheduling: 4-5 hour core, 2-6 naps of 10-20 minutes each

short_description: Transitional schedule resembling Dymaxion, with one core sleep and three Dymaxion naps.
classification: Dymaxion transitional schedule in an Everyman style
ideal_scheduling: Core sleep before midnight, naps at dawn, noon, and evening

short_description: Two core sleeps with one nap, emphasizing SWS in the first core and REM in the second core.
ideal_scheduling: Dusk core around 21:00 to 22:00, dawn core around 07:00 or 08:00, REM nap around early afternoon

short_description: Two core sleeps with two naps, focusing on SWS in the first core and REM in the second core.
ideal_scheduling: First core around 22:00, second core around 05:40, noon nap and afternoon nap

short_description: Two core sleeps with three naps, balancing SWS and REM across cores and naps.
ideal_scheduling: 3-hour wake between two cores, dawn nap, noon nap, and afternoon nap

short_description: Transitional schedule combining two core sleeps with four naps, following an Uberman-like rhythm.
classification: Uberman transitional schedule in a Dual Core style
ideal_scheduling: Cores before midnight and after midnight, dawn nap, mid-morning nap, mid-afternoon nap, and evening nap

short_description: Flexible variant including two core sleeps and multiple short naps, evolving from SPAMAYL.
classification: Flexible schedule, SPAMAYL variant, Dual Core variant
ideal_scheduling: 4.5-5 hours total sleep for both cores combined, 1-4 naps of 10-20 minutes each

short_description: Transitional schedule resembling Dymaxion, with two core sleeps and two Dymaxion naps.
classification: Dymaxion transitional schedule in a Dual Core style
ideal_scheduling: One core before midnight, one around dawn, Dymaxion noon nap, Dymaxion afternoon/evening nap

short_description: Three core sleeps with an additional long siesta to balance the schedule, focusing on SWS and REM in night cores.
ideal_scheduling: Night core around 21:00, dawn core around 05:30, noon core around 12:00

short_description: Three core sleeps with one nap, emphasizing one SWS core, two REM cores, and one REM nap.
ideal_scheduling: Dusk core, night core, dawn core, and one afternoon nap with a 3-hour rhythm between each core sleep

short_description: Three core sleeps with two naps, focusing on one SWS core, two REM cores, and two REM naps.
ideal_scheduling: Evening core, graveyard core, dawn core, and two daytime naps

short_description: Four core sleeps of 1 cycle each, emphasizing SWS and REM at specific times of day.
ideal_scheduling: Core around or before midnight, followed by cores around dawn, noon, and early/mid afternoon with adequate wake gaps.

schedule_type: Core As Much As You Like (CAMAYL)
short_description: Flexible schedule with multiple core sleeps, adapting from Quad Core 0 to allow for varying sleep stages based on homeostatic pressure.
ideal_scheduling: Approximately 4 core sleeps of 90 minutes each, spaced throughout the day based on natural sleepiness and sleep stage requirements.

short_description: Extreme nap-only schedule with 6 equidistant 20-minute naps throughout the day.
ideal_scheduling: Nap slots are rotated freely, but equidistant placement of naps is recommended.

short_description: Extreme nap-only schedule with 4 equidistant 30-minute naps throughout the day.
ideal_scheduling: Naps placed at circadian spots: midnight, dawn, noon, and evening.

schedule_type: Sleep Polyphasically As Much As You Like (SPAMAYL)
short_description: Flexible nap-only schedule with no fixed rhythm, allowing for more than 6 20-minute naps per day on average.
ideal_scheduling: Most naps scheduled during graveyard hours to minimize daytime napping conflicts with work or social activities.

short_description: Extreme nap-only schedule with 4 equidistant 20-minute naps throughout the day.
ideal_scheduling: Naps placed at circadian spots: midnight, dawn, noon, and evening.
